humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that multiple (6 out of 17) left axillary lymph nodes are involved by metastatic lobular carcinoma (AJCC pN2). Therefore, based on the given rules and the information in the report, the pathologic N stage of the patient's cancer is N2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer is determined by the presence and extent of lymph node involvement. In this report, it is stated that multiple (6 out of 17) left axillary lymph nodes are involved by metastatic lobular carcinoma. This means that the cancer has spread to at least 6 lymph nodes, which corresponds to an N2 stage. The focal extracapsular extension also supports this staging. The N stage is not further subclassified in this report.
